00024 #include "gnilnd.h"
00025 #if defined(GNILND_USE_RCA)
00026 #include <rsms/rs_sm_states.h>
00027 #endif
00028 /* Advance all timeouts by nap_time seconds. */
00029 void
00030 kgnilnd_bump_timeouts(__u32 nap_time, char *reason)
00031 {
00032         int                     i;
00033         kgn_peer_t             *peer;
00034         kgn_conn_t             *conn;
00035         kgn_tx_t               *tx;
00036         kgn_device_t           *dev;
00037         kgn_dgram_t            *dgram;
00038 
00039         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: bumping all timeouts by %ds\n", reason, nap_time);
00040 
00041         LASSERTF(GNILND_IS_QUIESCED, "gnilnd not quiesced %d != %d\n",
00042                  atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nquiesce),
00043                  atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nthreads));
00044 
00045         /* requiring that the threads are paused ensures a couple of things:
00046          * - combined code paths for stack reset and quiesce event as stack reset
00047          *   runs with the threads paused
00048          * - prevents traffic to the Gemini during a quiesce period
00049          * - reduces the locking requirements
00050         */
00051 
00052         for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size; i++) {
00053                 list_for_each_entry(peer, &kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers[i], gnp_list) {
00054 
00055                         /* we can reconnect again at any time */
00056                         peer->gnp_reconnect_time = jiffies;
00057                         /* reset now that network is healthy */
00058                         peer->gnp_reconnect_interval = 0;
00059                         /* tell LNet dude is still alive */
00060                         kgnilnd_peer_alive(peer);
00061                         kgnilnd_peer_notify(peer, 0, 1);
00062 
00063                         list_for_each_entry(tx, &peer->gnp_tx_queue, tx_list) {
00064                                 tx->tx_qtime = jiffies;
00065                         }
00066 
00067                         list_for_each_entry(conn, &peer->gnp_conns, gnc_list) {
00068                                 unsigned long           timeout;
00069 
00070                                 timeout = cfs_time_seconds(conn->gnc_timeout);
00071 
00072                                 /* bump last_rx/last_rx_cq on all conns - including
00073                                  * closed ones, this will have the effect of
00074                                  * bumping the purgatory timers for those */
00075                                 conn->gnc_last_rx = conn->gnc_last_rx_cq = jiffies;
00076 
00077                                 /* we don't timeout based on old gnc_last_tx, so
00078                                  * we'll back it up and schedule the conn to trigger
00079                                  * a NOOP */
00080                                 conn->gnc_last_tx = jiffies - timeout;
00081                                 if (conn->gnc_state != GNILND_CONN_DONE)
00082                                 kgnilnd_schedule_conn(conn);
00083                         }
00084                 }
00085         }
00086 
00087         for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; i++) {
00088                 dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i];
00089                 for (i = 0; i < (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size - 1); i++) {
00090                         list_for_each_entry(dgram, &dev->gnd_dgrams[i], gndg_list) {
00091                                 dgram->gndg_post_time = jiffies;
00092                         }
00093                 }
00094         }
00095 }
00096 
00097 /* Quiesce or wake up the stack.  The caller must hold the kgn_quiesce_sem semaphore
00098  * on entry, which holds off any pending stack shutdown.   */
00099 void
00100 kgnilnd_quiesce_wait(char *reason)
00101 {
00102         int             i;
00103 
00104         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger) {
00105                 unsigned long   quiesce_deadline, quiesce_to;
00106                 /* FREEZE TAG!!!! */
00107 
00108                 /* morning sunshine */
00109                 spin_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
00110                 wake_up_all(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_waitq);
00111                 spin_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
00112 
00113                 for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; i++) {
00114                         kgn_device_t *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i];
00115 
00116                         wake_up_all(&dev->gnd_waitq);
00117                         wake_up_all(&dev->gnd_dgram_waitq);
00118                         wake_up_all(&dev->gnd_dgping_waitq);
00119                 }
00120 
00121                 kgnilnd_wakeup_rca_thread();
00122 
00123                 /* we'll wait for 10x the timeout for the threads to pause */
00124                 quiesce_to = cfs_time_seconds(*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_timeout * 10);
00125                 quiesce_deadline = (long) jiffies + quiesce_to;
00126 
00127                 LCONSOLE_INFO("Quiesce start: %s\n", reason);
00128                 /* wait for everyone to check-in as quiesced */
00129                 while (!GNILND_IS_QUIESCED) {
00130                         CDEBUG(D_INFO,
00131                                  "%s: Waiting for %d threads to pause\n",
00132                                  reason,
00133                                  atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nthreads) -
00134                                  atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nquiesce));
00135                         CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_QUIESCE_RACE);
00136                         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00137                         schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1 * i));
00138 
00139                         LASSERTF(quiesce_deadline > jiffies,
00140                                  "couldn't quiesce threads in %lu seconds, falling over now\n",
00141                                  cfs_duration_sec(quiesce_to));
00142                 }
00143 
00144                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: All threads paused!\n", reason);
00145                 /* XXX Nic: Is there a set of counters we can grab here to
00146                  * ensure that there is no traffic until quiesce is over ?*/
00147         } else {
00148                 LCONSOLE_INFO("Quiesce complete: %s\n", reason);
00149 
00150                 for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; i++) {
00151                         kgn_device_t *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i];
00152                         kgnilnd_schedule_dgram(dev);
00153                 }
00154 
00155                 /* wait for everyone to check-in as running - they will be spinning
00156                  * and looking, so no need to poke any waitq */
00157                 while (atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nquiesce) > 0) {
00158                         CDEBUG(D_INFO,
00159                                  "%s: Waiting for %d threads to wake up\n",
00160                                   reason,
00161                                   atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nquiesce));
00162                         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00163                         schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1 * i));
00164                 }
00165 
00166                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: All threads awake!\n", reason);
00167         }
00168 }
00169 
00170 /* Reset the stack.  */
00171 void
00172 kgnilnd_reset_stack(void)
00173 {
00174         int              i, rc = 0;
00175         kgn_net_t       *net;
00176         kgn_peer_t      *peer, *peerN;
00177         LIST_HEAD        (souls);
00178         char            *reason = "critical hardware error";
00179         __u32            seconds;
00180         unsigned long    start, end;
00181         ENTRY;
00182 
00183         /* Race with del_peer and its atomics */
00184         CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_RACE_RESET);
00185 
00186         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init != GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
00187                 CERROR("can't reset the stack, gnilnd is not initialized\n");
00188                 RETURN_EXIT;
00189         }
00190 
00191         /* First make sure we are not already quiesced - we panic if so,
00192          * as that could leave software in a bad state */
00193         LASSERTF(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger == GNILND_QUIESCE_IDLE,
00194                 "can't reset the stack, already doing so: trigger %d\n",
00195                  kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger);
00196 
00197         set_mb(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger, GNILND_QUIESCE_RESET);
00198 
00199         /* wake up the dgram waitq thread - but after trigger set to make sure it
00200          * goes into quiesce */
00201         CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_WC_DGRAM_FREE);
00202         /* same for scheduler that is dropping state transitiosn */
00203         CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_DROP_CLOSING);
00204         CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_DROP_DESTROY_EP);
00205 
00206         kgnilnd_quiesce_wait(reason);
00207 
00208         start = jiffies;
00209 
00210         kgnilnd_data.kgn_in_reset = 1;
00211         kgnilnd_data.kgn_nresets++;
00212         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: resetting all resources (count %d)\n",
00213                       reason, kgnilnd_data.kgn_nresets);
00214 
00215         for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_net_hash_size; i++) {
00216                 list_for_each_entry(net, &kgnilnd_data.kgn_nets[i], gnn_list) {
00217                         rc = kgnilnd_cancel_net_dgrams(net);
00218                         LASSERTF(rc == 0, "couldn't cleanup datagrams: %d\n", rc);
00219                 }
00220         }
00221 
00222         /* error -ENOTRECOVERABLE is stack reset */
00223         kgnilnd_del_conn_or_peer(NULL, LNET_NID_ANY, GNILND_DEL_CONN, -ENOTRECOVERABLE);
00224 
00225         for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; i++) {
00226                 kgn_device_t    *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i];
00227                 kgnilnd_cancel_wc_dgrams(dev);
00228                 kgnilnd_wait_for_canceled_dgrams(dev);
00229         }
00230 
00231         /* manually do some conn processing ala kgnilnd_process_conns */
00232         for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; i++) {
00233                 kgn_device_t    *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i];
00234                 kgn_conn_t      *conn;
00235                 int              conn_sched;
00236 
00237                 /* go find all the closed conns that need to be nuked - the
00238                  * scheduler thread isn't running to do this for us */
00239 
00240                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "will try to clear up %d ready_conns\n",
00241                         kgnilnd_count_list(&dev->gnd_ready_conns));
00242 
00243                 /* use while/list_first_entry loop to ensure we can handle any
00244                  * DESTROY_EP conns added from kgnilnd_complete_closed_conn */
00245                 while (!list_empty(&dev->gnd_ready_conns)) {
00246                         conn = list_first_entry(&dev->gnd_ready_conns,
00247                                                 kgn_conn_t, gnc_schedlist);
00248                         conn_sched = xchg(&conn->gnc_scheduled, GNILND_CONN_PROCESS);
00249 
00250                         LASSERTF(conn_sched != GNILND_CONN_IDLE &&
00251                                  conn_sched != GNILND_CONN_PROCESS,
00252                                  "conn %p on ready list but in bad state: %d\n",
00253                                  conn, conn_sched);
00254 
00255                         list_del_init(&conn->gnc_schedlist);
00256 
00257                         if (conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_CLOSING) {
00258                                 /* bump to CLOSED to fake out send of CLOSE */
00259                                 conn->gnc_state = GNILND_CONN_CLOSED;
00260                                 conn->gnc_close_sent = 1;
00261                         }
00262 
00263                         if (conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_DESTROY_EP) {
00264                                 kgnilnd_destroy_conn_ep(conn);
00265                         } else {
00266                                 kgnilnd_complete_closed_conn(conn);
00267                         }
00268 
00269                         /* there really shouldn't be any other states here -
00270                          * they would have been cleared out in the del_peer_or_conn or the dgram
00271                          * aborts above.
00272                          * there is an LASSERTF in kgnilnd_complete_closed_conn that will take
00273                          * care of catching anything else for us */
00274 
00275                         kgnilnd_schedule_process_conn(conn, -1);
00276 
00277                         kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
00278                 }
00279         }
00280 
00281         /* don't let the little weasily purgatory conns hide from us */
00282         for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size; i++) {
00283                 list_for_each_entry_safe(peer, peerN, &kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers[i], gnp_list) {
00284                         kgn_conn_t       *conn, *connN;
00285 
00286                         list_for_each_entry_safe(conn, connN, &peer->gnp_conns, gnc_list) {
00287                                 kgnilnd_detach_purgatory_locked(conn, &souls);
00288                         }
00289                 }
00290         }
00291 
00292         CDEBUG(D_NET, "about to release %d purgatory entries\n",
00293                 kgnilnd_count_list(&souls));
00294 
00295         kgnilnd_release_purgatory_list(&souls);
00296 
00297         /* validate we are now clean */
00298         for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; i++) {
00299                 kgn_device_t    *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i];
00300 
00301                 /* now all the cons/mboxes should be cleaned up, including purgatory
00302                  * so go through and release the MDDs for our persistent PHYS fma_blks
00303                  */
00304                 kgnilnd_unmap_fma_blocks(dev);
00305 
00306                 LASSERTF(atomic_read(&dev->gnd_nfmablk) == 0,
00307                         "reset failed: fma blocks still live %d\n",
00308                         atomic_read(&dev->gnd_nfmablk));
00309 
00310                 LASSERTF(atomic_read(&dev->gnd_neps) == 0,
00311                         "reset failed: EP handles still live %d\n",
00312                         atomic_read(&dev->gnd_neps));
00313         }
00314 
00315         LASSERTF(atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns) == 0,
00316                 "reset failed: conns left %d\n",
00317                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns));
00318 
00319         /* fine to have peers left - they are waiting for new conns
00320          * but should not be holding any open HW resources */
00321 
00322         /* like the last part of kgnilnd_base_shutdown() */
00323 
00324         CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_SR_DOWN_RACE);
00325 
00326         for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; i++) {
00327                 kgnilnd_dev_fini(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i]);
00328         }
00329 
00330         /* no need to free and recreate the TX descriptors
00331          * we nuked all the ones that could be using HW resources in
00332          * kgnilnd_close_matching_conns and asserted it worked in
00333          * kgnilnd_dev_fini */
00334 
00335         /* At this point, all HW is torn down, start to reset */
00336 
00337         /* only reset our known devs */
00338         for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; i++) {
00339                 kgn_device_t    *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i];
00340                 rc = kgnilnd_dev_init(dev);
00341                 LASSERTF(rc == 0, "dev_init failed for dev %d\n", i);
00342                 kgnilnd_map_phys_fmablk(dev);
00343                 LASSERTF(rc == 0, "map_phys_fmablk failed for dev %d\n", i);
00344                 rc = kgnilnd_setup_wildcard_dgram(dev);
00345                 LASSERTF(rc == 0, "couldnt setup datagrams on dev %d: %d\n",
00346                         i, rc);
00347         }
00348 
00349         /* Now the fun restarts... - release the hounds! */
00350 
00351         end = jiffies;
00352         seconds = cfs_duration_sec((long)end - start);
00353         kgnilnd_bump_timeouts(seconds, reason);
00354 
00355         kgnilnd_data.kgn_in_reset = 0;
00356         set_mb(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger, GNILND_QUIESCE_IDLE);
00357         kgnilnd_quiesce_wait(reason);
00358         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s reset of all hardware resources\n",
00359                 rc ? "failed" : "successful");
00360 
00361         RETURN_EXIT;
00362 }
00363 
00364 /* A thread that handles quiece and reset hardware events.
00365  * We do the same thing regardless of which device reported the event. */
00366 int
00367 kgnilnd_ruhroh_thread(void *arg)
00368 {
00369         int                i = 1;
00370         DEFINE_WAIT(wait);
00371 
00372         cfs_block_allsigs();
00373         set_user_nice(current, *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_nice);
00374         kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_running = 1;
00375 
00376         while (1) {
00377 
00378                 /* Block until there's a request..  A reset request could come in
00379                  * while we're handling a quiesce one, or vice versa.
00380                  * Keep processing requests until there are none.*/
00381                 prepare_to_wait(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_waitq, &wait, TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00382                 while (!(kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_shutdown ||
00383                                 kgnilnd_data.kgn_needs_reset || kgnilnd_data.kgn_needs_pause))
00384                         schedule();
00385                 finish_wait(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_waitq, &wait);
00386 
00387                /* Exit if the driver is shutting down. */
00388                 if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_shutdown)
00389                         break;
00390 
00391                 /* Serialize with driver startup and shutdown. */
00392                 mutex_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_mutex);
00393 
00394                CDEBUG(D_NET, "trigger %d reset %d to_bump %d pause %d\n",
00395                         kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger,
00396                         kgnilnd_data.kgn_needs_reset,
00397                         kgnilnd_data.kgn_bump_info_rdy,
00398                         kgnilnd_data.kgn_needs_pause);
00399 
00400                 /* Do we need to do a pause/quiesce? */
00401                 if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_needs_pause) {
00402 
00403                         /* Pause all other kgnilnd threads. */
00404                         set_mb(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger, GNILND_QUIESCE_HW_QUIESCE);
00405                         kgnilnd_quiesce_wait("hardware quiesce");
00406 
00407                         /* If the hardware quiesce flag is set, wait for it to clear.
00408                          * This should happen relatively quickly, so we wait for it.
00409                          * This will hold up the eventd thread, but on everything but
00410                          * the simulator, this is ok-- there is one thread per core.
00411                          *
00412                          * Handle (possibly multiple) quiesce events while we wait. The
00413                          * memory barrier ensures that the core doesn't start fetching
00414                          * kgn_bump_info_rdy before it fetches kgn_needs_pause, and
00415                          * matches the second mb in kgnilnd_quiesce_end_callback(). */
00416                         smp_rmb();
00417                         while (kgnilnd_hw_in_quiesce() || kgnilnd_data.kgn_bump_info_rdy) {
00418 
00419                                 i++;
00420                                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Waiting for hardware quiesce "
00421                                                "flag to clear\n");
00422                                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00423                                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1 * i));
00424 
00425                                 /* If we got a quiesce event with bump info, DO THE BUMP!. */
00426                                 if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_bump_info_rdy) {
00427                                         /* reset console rate limiting for each event */
00428                                         i = 1;
00429 
00430                                         /* Make sure the core doesn't start fetching
00431                                          * kgni_quiesce_seconds until after it sees
00432                                          * kgn_bump_info_rdy set.  This is the match to the
00433                                          * first mb in kgnilnd_quiesce_end_callback(). */
00434                                         smp_rmb();
00435                                         (void) kgnilnd_bump_timeouts(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_secs,
00436                                                                "hardware quiesce callback");
00437                                         set_mb(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_secs, 0);
00438                                         set_mb(kgnilnd_data.kgn_bump_info_rdy, 0);
00439                                 }
00440                       }
00441 
00442                         /* Reset the kgn_needs_pause flag before coming out of
00443                          * the pause.  This ordering avoids a race with the
00444                          * setting of this flag in kgnilnd_pause_threads().  */
00445                         set_mb(kgnilnd_data.kgn_needs_pause, 0);
00446 
00447                         /* ok, let the kids back into the pool */
00448                         set_mb(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger, GNILND_QUIESCE_IDLE);
00449                         kgnilnd_quiesce_wait("hardware quiesce");
00450                 }
00451 
00452                 /* Do a stack reset if needed. */
00453                 if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_needs_reset) {
00454                         kgnilnd_reset_stack();
00455                         set_mb(kgnilnd_data.kgn_needs_reset, 0);
00456                 }
00457 
00458                 mutex_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_mutex);
00459         }
00460 
00461         kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_running = 0;
00462         return 0;
00463 }
00464 
00465 /* Set pause request flag.  Any functions that
00466  * call this one are responsible for ensuring that
00467  * variables they set up are visible on other cores before
00468  * this flag setting.  This executes in interrupt or kernel
00469  * thread context.  */
00470 void
00471 kgnilnd_pause_threads(void)
00472 {
00473         /* only device 0 gets the handle, see kgnilnd_dev_init */
00474         kgn_device_t  *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[0];
00475         LASSERTF(dev != NULL, "dev 0 is NULL\n");
00476 
00477         /* If we're currently in a pause triggered by the pause flag,
00478          * there's no need to set it again.  We clear the kgn_needs_pause
00479          * flag before we reset kgn_quiesce_trigger to avoid a race.  The
00480          * read memory barrier matches the setmb() on the trigger in
00481          * kgnilnd_ruhroh_task().                                       */
00482         smp_rmb();
00483         if (!(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger == GNILND_QUIESCE_HW_QUIESCE &&
00484                         GNILND_IS_QUIESCED)) {
00485                  CDEBUG(D_NET, "requesting thread pause\n");
00486 
00487                 kgnilnd_data.kgn_needs_pause = 1;
00488 
00489                 wake_up(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_waitq);
00490         } else {
00491             CDEBUG(D_NET, "thread pause already underway\n");
00492         }
00493 }
00494 
00495 /* Return non-zero if the GNI hardware quiesce flag is set */
00496 int
00497 kgnilnd_hw_in_quiesce(void)
00498 {
00499         /* only device 0 gets the handle, see kgnilnd_dev_init */
00500         kgn_device_t      *dev0 = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[0];
00501 
00502         LASSERTF(dev0 != NULL, "dev 0 is NULL\n");
00503 
00504         smp_rmb();
00505         return kgnilnd_get_quiesce_status(dev0->gnd_handle) != 0;
00506 }
00507 
00508 
00509 /* If the GNI hardware quiesce flag is set, initiate our pause and
00510  * return non-zero.  Also return non-zero if the stack is shutting down. */
00511 int
00512 kgnilnd_check_hw_quiesce(void)
00513 {
00514         if (likely(!kgnilnd_hw_in_quiesce()))
00515                 return 0;
00516 
00517         if (!kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_shutdown) {
00518                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "initiating thread pause\n");
00519                 kgnilnd_pause_threads();
00520         } else {
00521                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "thread pause bypassed because of shutdown\n");
00522         }
00523 
00524         return 1;
00525 }
00526 
00527 /* Callback from kngi with the quiesce duration.  This executes
00528  * in interrupt context.                                        */
00529 void
00530 kgnilnd_quiesce_end_callback(gni_nic_handle_t nic_handle, uint64_t msecs)
00531 {
00532         /* only device 0 gets the handle, see kgnilnd_dev_init */
00533         kgn_device_t  *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[0];
00534         LASSERTF(dev != NULL, "dev 0 is NULL\n");
00535 
00536         if (!kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_shutdown) {
00537 
00538                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "requesting timeout bump by "LPD64" msecs\n", msecs);
00539 
00540                 /* Save the bump interval and request the bump.
00541                  * The memory barrier ensures that the interval is in place before
00542                  * the bump flag can be seen (in case a core is already running the
00543                  * ruhroh task), and that the bump request flag in place before
00544                  * the pause request can be seen (to ensure a core doesn't miss the bump
00545                  * request flag).       */
00546                 /* If another callback occurred before the ruhroh task
00547                  * finished processing the first bump request, we'd over-write its info.
00548                  * Nic says that callbacks occur so slowly that this isn't an issue.    */
00549                 set_mb(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_secs, msecs / MSEC_PER_SEC);
00550                 set_mb(kgnilnd_data.kgn_bump_info_rdy, 1);
00551                 kgnilnd_pause_threads();
00552         } else {
00553                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "timeout bump bypassed because of shutdown\n");
00554         }
00555 }
00556 
00557 void
00558 kgnilnd_critical_error(struct gni_err *err_handle)
00559 {
00560         /* only device 0 gets the handle, see kgnilnd_dev_init */
00561         kgn_device_t  *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[0];
00562         LASSERTF(dev != NULL, "dev 0 is NULL\n");
00563 
00564         if (!kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_shutdown) {
00565                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "requesting stack reset\n");
00566                 kgnilnd_data.kgn_needs_reset = 1;
00567                 wake_up(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_waitq);
00568         } else {
00569                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "stack reset bypassed because of shutdown\n");
00570         }
00571 }
00572 
00573 #if defined(GNILND_USE_RCA)
00574 #include <krca_lib.h>
00575 #define RCA_EVENTS 3
00576 /* RCA ticket is needed for krca_wakeup_wait_event() */
00577 static krca_ticket_t rca_krt = KRCA_NULL_TICKET;
00578 struct rcadata {
00579         rca_ticket_t ticket;
00580         int subscribed;
00581         rs_event_code_t ec;
00582 };
00583 static struct rcadata rd[RCA_EVENTS] = {
00584         {0, 0, ec_node_unavailable},
00585         {0, 0, ec_node_available},
00586         {0, 0, ec_node_failed}
00587 };
00588 
00589 /* thread for receiving rca events */
00590 int
00591 kgnilnd_rca(void *arg)
00592 {
00593         int        i, rc;
00594         int        retry_count;
00595         rs_event_t event;
00596         lnet_nid_t nid;
00597 
00598         cfs_block_allsigs();
00599 
00600         /* all gnilnd threads need to run fairly urgently */
00601         set_user_nice(current, *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_nice);
00602 
00603         /*
00604          * Register our service with RCA and subscribe to events
00605          * of interest.
00606          */
00607         rca_krt = KRCA_NULL_TICKET;
00608         rc = krca_register(&rca_krt, RCA_SVCTYPE_GNILND, current->pid, 0);
00609         if (rc < 0) {
00610                 CNETERR("krca_register(%x) returned %d\n", current->pid, rc);
00611                 goto done;
00612         }
00613 
00614         for (i = 0; i < RCA_EVENTS; i++) {
00615                 retry_count = 0;
00616 subscribe_retry:
00617                 rc = krca_subscribe(&rca_krt, rd[i].ec, RCA_RX_SVC_ANY,
00618                                     &rd[i].ticket);
00619 
00620                 if ((rc == -EINTR) && !retry_count) {
00621                         retry_count++;
00622                         CNETERR("krca_subscribe returned %d - retrying\n", rc);
00623                         goto subscribe_retry;
00624                 }
00625 
00626                 if (rc < 0) {
00627                         CNETERR("rca subscription failed (%d)\n", rc);
00628                         goto done;
00629                 }
00630 
00631                 rd[i].subscribed = 1;
00632         }
00633 
00634         while (!kgnilnd_data.kgn_shutdown) {
00635                 if (unlikely(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger)) {
00636                         KGNILND_SPIN_QUIESCE;
00637                 }
00638                 /* wait here for a subscribed event */
00639                 rc = krca_wait_event(&rca_krt);
00640 
00641                 /* RCA return values:
00642                  * 0 indicates krca_wakeup_wait_event caused krca_wait_event
00643                  *   return.
00644                  * -ERESTARTSYS indicates krca_wait_event returned because of a
00645                  *   signal.
00646                  * -ENOSPC indicates no space available to create an rcad_reg_t
00647                  * 1 indicates a message is waiting.
00648                  */
00649                 if (rc <= 0) {
00650                         continue;
00651                 }
00652 
00653                 if (krca_get_message(&rca_krt, &event) == 0) {
00654                         int node_down = GNILND_RCA_NODE_UNKNOWN;
00655                         rs_state_t state;
00656                         LIST_HEAD(zombies);
00657 
00658                         /* Compute nodes don't care about other compute nodes
00659                          * so we don't need to create a peer.
00660                          */
00661                         if (GNILND_COMPUTE &&
00662                             !RSN_GET_FLD(event.ev_gen.svid_node.rs_node_flat,
00663                                         IS_SVC)) {
00664                                 continue;
00665                         }
00666 
00667                         /* Only care about compute and service nodes not GPUs */
00668                         if (!(RSN_GET_FLD(event.ev_gen.svid_node.rs_node_flat,
00669                                         TYPE) == rt_node ||
00670                              RSN_GET_FLD(event.ev_gen.svid_node.rs_node_flat,
00671                                         TYPE) == rt_accel)) {
00672                                                 continue;
00673                         }
00674 
00675                         switch (event.ev_id) {
00676                         case ec_node_available:
00677                                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "ec_node_available\n");
00678                                 node_down = GNILND_RCA_NODE_UP;
00679                                 break;
00680                         case ec_node_failed:
00681                                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "ec_node_failed\n");
00682                                 if (event.ev_len > 0) {
00683                                         CDEBUG(D_ERROR,
00684                                                 "ec_node_failed ignored\n");
00685                                         break;
00686                                 }
00687                                 node_down = GNILND_RCA_NODE_DOWN;
00688                                 break;
00689                         case ec_node_unavailable:
00690                                 state = RSN_GET_FLD(event.ev_gen.svid_node.rsn_intval, STATE);
00691 
00692                                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "ec_node_unavailable\n");
00693 
00694                                 /*
00695                                  * Ignore overloaded ec_node_unavailable events
00696                                  * generated by 'xtcli set_reserve'.
00697                                  */
00698                                 if (RS_GET_CS_STATE(state) == RS_CS_READY) {
00699                                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "ignoring "
00700                                                 "ec_node_unavailable event with"
00701                                                 " RS_CS_READY state\n");
00702                                         break;
00703                                 }
00704                                 node_down = GNILND_RCA_NODE_DOWN;
00705                                 break;
00706                         default:
00707                                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "unknown event\n");
00708                                 break;
00709                         }
00710 
00711                         /* if we get an event we don't know about, just go ahead
00712                          * and wait for another event */
00713                         if (node_down == GNILND_RCA_NODE_UNKNOWN) {
00714                                 continue;
00715                         }
00716 
00717                         nid = RSN_GET_FLD(event.ev_gen.svid_node.rs_node_flat,
00718                                           NID);
00719                         CDEBUG(D_INFO,"kgnilnd_rca() reporting nid %d %s\n",
00720                                (int)nid, node_down ? "down" : "up");
00721                         kgnilnd_report_node_state(nid, node_down);
00722 
00723                 } else {
00724                         CNETERR("krca_get_message failed\n");
00725                 }
00726         }
00727 
00728 done:
00729         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "done\n");
00730 
00731         for (i = 0; i < RCA_EVENTS; i++) {
00732                 if (rd[i].subscribed) {
00733                         rc = krca_unsubscribe(&rca_krt, rd[i].ticket);
00734 
00735                         if (rc) {
00736                                 CNETERR("rca unsubscribe failed (%d)\n", rc);
00737                         }
00738 
00739                         rd[i].subscribed = 0;
00740                 }
00741         }
00742 
00743         krca_unregister(&rca_krt);
00744         kgnilnd_thread_fini();
00745         return 0;
00746 
00747 }
00748 
00749 int
00750 kgnilnd_start_rca_thread(void)
00751 {
00752         return kgnilnd_thread_start(kgnilnd_rca, NULL, "kgnilnd_rca", 0);
00753 }
00754 
00755 void
00756 kgnilnd_wakeup_rca_thread(void)
00757 {
00758         int ret;
00759 
00760         ret = krca_wakeup_wait_event(&rca_krt);
00761 
00762         if (ret) {
00763                 CDEBUG(D_ERROR, "krca_wakeup_wait_event failed\n");
00764         }
00765 }
00766 
00767 int
00768 kgnilnd_get_node_state(__u32 nid)
00769 {
00770         int i;
00771         int rc = GNILND_RCA_NODE_UNKNOWN;
00772         int ret;
00773         rs_node_array_t nlist;
00774         rs_node_t       *na = NULL;
00775 
00776         if ((ret = krca_get_sysnodes(&nlist)) < 0) {
00777                 CDEBUG(D_NETERROR, "krca_get_sysnodes failed %d\n", ret);
00778                 goto ns_done;
00779         }
00780 
00781         na = nlist.na_ids;
00782 
00783         for (i = 0; i < nlist.na_len; i++) {
00784                 if ((rca_nid_t)RSN_GET_FLD(na[i].rs_node_flat, NID) == nid) {
00785                         rc = RSN_GET_FLD(na[i].rs_node_flat, STATE) == RS_CS_READY ?
00786                                 GNILND_RCA_NODE_UP : GNILND_RCA_NODE_DOWN;
00787                         break;
00788                 }
00789         }
00790 
00791 ns_done:
00792         kfree(na);
00793         CDEBUG(D_NET, "nid %d rc %d (0=up)\n", nid, rc);
00794         return rc;
00795 }
00796 
00797 #else /* GNILND_USE_RCA */
00798 
00799 int
00800 kgnilnd_start_rca_thread(void)
00801 {
00802         return 0;
00803 }
00804 
00805 void
00806 kgnilnd_wakeup_rca_thread(void)
00807 {
00808 }
00809 
00810 int
00811 kgnilnd_get_node_state(__u32 nid)
00812 {
00813         return GNILND_RCA_NODE_UP;
00814 }
00815 #endif /* GNILND_USE_RCA */
